channel.title: Supreme Commander 2 to run on Steam
channel.description:
[quote] Taylor announced another improvement to the game, this time affecting multiplayer: SupCom 2 will be completely supported and integrated into Steam and utilise Valve's superior server browser. GPG net will not be making the transition. [/quote] As the quote above states, Chris Taylor has announced that SupCom2 will follow the way of Modern Warfare2 and require steam. Heres the link to the [url='https://pc.ign.com/articles/105/1058207p1.html']full article[/url]. I am happy to hear this personally, and hope they offer SupCom1 on Steam aswell, (I only have Forged Alliance).
I am a little wary of their changes to resource aquisition and usage. Sure the resources are a bit difficult for the beginner to pick up, but they aren't to difficult once you play for a bit. I liked that fact that I only had to manage 2 resources and I couldn't run out of either. SupCom2 sounds amazing, but I hope they don't make what made SupCom1 great watered down just to appeal to a broader audience. Thoughts?
